trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.PagerCommand"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> object raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.PagerCommand> event when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton> control that is inside the pager field is clicked.

These buttons are child controls that can be defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.PagerTemplate%2A> template of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> field.
During the event, you can perform tasks such as changing the number of rows that will be displayed or changing the index of the first item on the page.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the DataPagerCommandEventArgs class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs"></xref> class.
You can use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class.
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is primarily used by control developers when raising events.

The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class |Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.PagerField%2A>|The value of the `pagerField` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.TotalRowCount%2A>|The value of the `totalRowCount` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.Item%2A>|The value of the `item` parameter.|
The object that contains the command button that was clicked.
The total number of records.
The command name and command argument of the button that was clicked.
The object that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object and its container <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> object.

Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem"></xref> object that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object and the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object's container <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object, which is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem> object returned by this property, contains the button that was clicked.
Alternatively, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.PagerField%2A> property to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object.

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem"></xref> object that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object and the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object's container <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the maximum number of records to display on each page of data.
When you set a value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.NewStartRowIndex%2A> property, you must also set the NewMaximumRows property.

If you do not want to change the current value, you can set the NewMaximumRows property to the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.MaximumRows%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
You can access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.Item%2A> property.
The maximum number of records to display on each page of data.
The default is -1, which indicates that this property is not set.
Gets or sets the index of the first record to display on a page of data.
You usually set this property to change the page number that is currently being displayed.
When you set a value for the NewStartRowIndex property, you must also set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.NewMaximumRows%2A> property.
The index of the first record that will be displayed on a page of data.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object that contains the button that was clicked.
Use the PagerField property to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object contains the button that was clicked.
The object that contains the button that was clicked.
Gets the total number of records to display.
Use the TotalRowCount property to retrieve the total number of records in the associated data source.
The total number of records to display.
